p.span:
Thank you for everyone that came out to see the lights. We shall see you next Friday 8 pm.
#go Savages

img.alt: Thank you for everyone that came out to see the lights. We shall see you next Friday 8 pm. #Go Savages
Thank you for everyone that came out to see the lights. We shall see you next Friday 8 pm. #Go Savages

div.p: It was a pretty amazing sight from our house!! 😊

p.span:
Popsicles with the Principal
I will be doing a google hangout on Monday at 11:00 with all students in grades 7-12. Please encourage your children to join me. Parents, you are more than welcome to listen in. I emailed each student an invite to the hangout. I will be updating everyone on how the remainder of the school year will look. I will also be discussing Prom & Graduation details. Today has been a difficult for all of us. I miss my kids, my teachers, & everyone within our Savage Family! Stay safe and I hope to see you all on Monday at 11:00
Love you,
Mrs. Webb

div.p: Rhonda Tollenaar-Huffman if you hadn't seen it yet

p.span: Tonight we will be lighting up the Football Stadium, Baseball and Softball field in honor of our Seniors. The lights will be on from 8 pm til 8:43 pm. 1 minute for each of our Seniors. Please come by and give us a honk. Please do not get out of your cars and congregate. #LightUpIowa. Go Savages!!

img.alt: Tonight we will be lighting up the Football Stadium, Baseball and Softball field in honor of our Seniors. The lights will be on from 8 pm til 8:43 pm. 1 minute for each of our Seniors. Please come by and give us a honk. Please do not get out of your cars and congregate. #lightUPIowa. Go Savages!!

Tonight we will be lighting up the Football Stadium, Baseball and Softball field in honor of our Seniors. The lights will be on from 8 pm til 8:43 pm. 1 minute for each of our Seniors. Please come by and give us a honk. Please do not get out of your cars and congregate. #lightUPIowa. Go Savages!!

p.span:
Communication - 4/17/2020
Sigourney Families,
WOW - Today we found out that the Governor announced that all schools in Iowa will remain closed through the end of the school year to help prevent the further spread of COVID-19. We have many unanswered questions and I ask you to be patient as we develop plans.
This announcement will continue to impact all Sigourney Community School District programming, including before- and after-school activities, all athletic and extracurricular practices and competitions, and all weekend events. It is our hope that we will be able to reschedule Prom and graduation, but we do not yet know how these events will look. We do want to make these events special for our students so we are working at developing something unique.
I know this decision has caused a great deal of concern and disappointment for our students, staff, and families. The pandemic arrived quickly, and when we first were directed to close our school buildings in March, we did not realize it would be the last time we would see our students in person this school year. Please know that we share in your disappointment.
Per our district calendar, the last day of school for students is Friday, May 22. We will continue with virtual learning until that date, just as we have over the past several weeks. We encourage all families to keep their students engaged in these activities to ensure learning continues to take place through the end of the school year. Our staff is ready to assist all families in these efforts, as well.
I want to make sure families understand not to get stressed over being thrusted into a home school position. I do not want you to feel overwhelmed with work being sent by the teacher. Please remember this is not required so if you are getting frustrated, please back off - You have my permission. The work is designed to ensure they are staying connected with school and the materials being covered in each of their classrooms. We know in the bigger scheme of life, this might not need to be a priority for families. We want you to take care of yourself and your family. Like I said before, we will work our tails off to get ALL kids caught up when we get them back to school.
We want our families’ to be engaging students in the learning resources we have provided and we know everyone is doing their best. We ask you to continue to do your best so our students are doing something from March 15 to August 24, but use common sense. This will ensure they are somewhat prepared to be successful next school year. Our staff is here to help you bridge this gap till we get them back into the classroom.
We will continue school lunch services through the extended school closure, as well. Currently, we are delivering meals on Mondays and Thursdays. These deliveries ensure meals for each school day through May 22 when our USDA funding will run out.
Once again, thank you for your patience, understanding, and flexibility during this unprecedented time. We will get through this together. Please continue to stay safe, practice social distancing, and keep our community in your thoughts and prayers. It is going to take a while for our families and communities to get back to normal, so please continue to lean on each other. If you have questions, please feel free to call me on my cell at 641-224-2524.
Sincerely,
Dave Harper , Superintendent

div.p: Is there a fund people can contribute to to keep the Dorito Dash going?

figure.class: wp-block-embed-youtube aligncenter wp-block-embed is-type-video is-provider-youtube wp-embed-aspect-16-9 wp-has-aspect-ratio

div.p: Sigourney Schools will be closed until Thursday, April 30.
The Public Hearing for the Proposed Fiscal Year 2020-2021 School Budget will take place at 6:00 P.M. April 8, 2020.

The Sigourney CSD will be holding their Board of Directors meeting on April 8, 2020 at 6:00 PM over Google Hangouts for the directors and on Facebook live for public viewing. https://www.facebook.com/sigourneyschools/
If you have comments for the board, please send to Sue Huls at sue.huls@sigourneyschools.com
NOTE: Only selected school board members will be allowed to attend in-person. The public must attend via Facebook Live.

div.a:
909 East Pleasant Valley Street Sigourney, Iowa
52591

div.p: The Sigourney CSD is seeking public comment on the District Developed Special Delivery Plan. Every five years the district reviews the plan for changes. If you have questions or comments, please contact Dave Harper at dave.harper@sigourneyschools.com.

p.strong: Sigourney Continuous Notification of Nondiscrimination Policy Statement
p.br: It is the policy of the Sigourney Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the district’s Equity Coordinator: Shannon Webb 641-622-2010
